query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 Intra due cibi, distanti e moventi 2 d’un modo, prima si morria di fame, 3 che liber’ omo l’un recasse ai denti;
query.error: **English:** 1 Between two foods, distant and moving 2 in the same way, one would die of hunger first, 3 before a free man would bring one to his teeth;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
4 sì si starebbe un agno intra due brame 5 di fieri lupi, igualmente temendo; 6 sì si starebbe un cane intra due dame:
query.error: **English:** 4 so would one stand for a year between two cravings 5 of fierce wolves, fearing them equally; 6 so would a dog stand between two does:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
7 per che, s’i’ mi tacea, me non riprendo, 8 da li miei dubbi d’un modo sospinto, 9 poi ch’era necessario, né commendo.
query.error: **English:** 7 because, if I kept silent, I would not blame myself, 8 driven in one direction by my doubts, 9 since it was necessary, nor do I praise myself.
query.result: 7 yasmāt, yadi aham maunam āśritya tiṣṭhāmi, na ātmānaṃ nindāmi, 8 mama saṃśayaiḥ ekena prakāreṇa pravṛttaḥ, 9 yataḥ āvśyakam āsīt, na ātmānaṃ praśaṃsāmi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
10 Io mi tacea, ma ’l mio disir dipinto 11 m’era nel viso, e ’l dimandar con ello, 12 più caldo assai che per parlar distinto.
query.error: **English:** 10 I was silent, but my desire was painted 11 on my face, and my questioning with it, 12 much hotter than if I had spoken distinctly.
query.result: 10 Aham maunaṃ babhūva, api tu mama icchā ālikhitā 11 āsīt mama mukhe, tasyāḥ saha pṛcchā api, 12 atiśayena uṣṇatarā āsīt yadi viśiṣṭena vākyena bhāṣitum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
13 Fé sì Beatrice qual fé Danïello, 14 Nabuccodonosor levando d’ira, 15 che l’avea fatto ingiustamente fello;
query.error: **English:** 13 Beatrice acted like Daniel, 14 calming Nebuchadnezzar's anger, 15 which had unjustly made him cruel;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
16 e disse: «Io veggio ben come ti tira 17 uno e altro disio, sì che tua cura 18 sé stessa lega sì che fuor non spira.
query.error: **English:** 16 and she said: "I see well how you are pulled 17 by one desire and then another, so that your concern 18 binds you so tightly that it cannot escape.
query.result: 16 Sa ca uvāca: "Paśyāmi aham tava cittaṃ katham ākrāmyate 17 ubhayataḥ kāmayor ubhayataḥ, yathā tava cinta 18 ātmanā ātmanam eva badhnāti yathā na niḥśvasitum śaknoti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
19 Tu argomenti: “Se ’l buon voler dura, 20 la vïolenza altrui per qual ragione 21 di meritar mi scema la misura?”.
query.error: **English:** 19 You argue: “If good will endures, 20 why should the violence of others 21 diminish the measure of my merit?”
query.result: 19 Tvam yuktiṃ kurṣe: “Yadi śubhā icchā dhīyate, 20 tadā anyasya himsākena kena kāraṇena 21 mama puṇyasya pramāṇam kṣīyate?”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
22 Ancor di dubitar ti dà cagione 23 parer tornarsi l’anime a le stelle, 24 secondo la sentenza di Platone.
query.error: **English:** 22 Even the opinion of Plato gives you reason to doubt 23 that souls return to the stars, 24 according to Plato's own judgment.
query.result: 22 Api saṃśayasya te kāraṇam dadāti 23 ātmānaṃ punar āgacchatīti tārāḥ, 24 yathā Platasya mate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 Queste son le question che nel tuo velle 26 pontano igualmente; e però pria 27 tratterò quella che più ha di felle.
query.error: **English:** 25 These are the questions that in your will 26 point equally; and therefore first 27 I will treat the one that is most bitter.
query.result: 25 Imāni praśnāni tava velle 26 samānaṃ lakṣyaṃ prayānti; atas tvam ādi 27 tatraiva pravakṣyāmi yat kiṃcid atiruṣṭam asti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
28 D’i Serafin colui che più s’india, 29 Moïsè, Samuel, e quel Giovanni 30 che prender vuoli, io dico, non Maria,
query.error: **English:** 28 Of the Seraphim, the one who soars highest, 29 Moses, Samuel, and that John 30 whom you wish to take, I say, not Mary,
query.result: 28 Serafīnām yaḥ adhikaḥ vistṛtaḥ asti, 29 Moīsaḥ, Sāmuēlaḥ, sa ca Janakaḥ 30 yaṃ gṛhṇīṣe tvam, aham bruve, na Māriyām,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
31 non hanno in altro cielo i loro scanni 32 che questi spirti che mo t’appariro, 33 né hanno a l’esser lor più o meno anni;
query.error: **English:** 31 have their seats in no other heaven 32 than these spirits who now appear to you, 33 nor do they have more or fewer years in their existence;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
34 ma tutti fanno bello il primo giro, 35 e differentemente han dolce vita 36 per sentir più e men l’etterno spiro.
query.error: **English:** 34 but all of them adorn the first circle, 35 and they have a life of varying sweetness 36 according to how much or how little they feel the eternal breath.
query.result: 34 sarve eva tu śobhayanti prathamam cakram, 35 viśeṣeṇa ca teṣām madhuraṃ jīvitam asti 36 yataḥ adhikaṃ vā alpam vā anubhavanti nityam prāṇavāyum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 Qui si mostraro, non perché sortita 38 sia questa spera lor, ma per far segno 39 de la celestïal c’ha men salita.
query.error: **English:** 37 Here they showed themselves, not because this sphere 38 is their exit, but to make a sign 39 of the celestial sphere that leads upward.
query.result: 37 Atra te darśayām āsuḥ, na yataḥ eṣā golakā 38 teṣām nirgamaḥ asti, api tu nimittaṃ kartum 39 divyasya golakasya yaḥ ūrdhvam nayati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
40 Così parlar conviensi al vostro ingegno, 41 però che solo da sensato apprende 42 ciò che fa poscia d’intelletto degno.
query.error: **English:** 40 Thus it is necessary to speak to your intellect, 41 because only from a wise person does one learn 42 that which later makes one worthy of understanding.
query.result: 40 Evam yuktam bruvāṇasya tava buddhyā, 41 tata eva hi jñānavān abhyeti, 42 yat paścāt buddher arham karoti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
43 Per questo la Scrittura condescende 44 a vostra facultate, e piedi e mano 45 attribuisce a Dio e altro intende;
query.error: **English:** 43 For this reason, Scripture condescends 44 to your capacity, and attributes 45 feet and hands to God, and intends something else;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
46 e Santa Chiesa con aspetto umano 47 Gabrïel e Michel vi rappresenta, 48 e l’altro che Tobia rifece sano.
query.error: **English:** 46 and Holy Church, with human aspect, 47 represents Gabriel and Michael to you, 48 and the other who made Tobit well again.
query.result: 46 Tathā ca śānta-śāstram mānuṣīṃ mūrtim āśritya 47 Gabrīēl-Mikāēl-ādyān ādarśayati, 48 Yaś ca Tobiyam ārogyaṃ cakāra.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
49 Quel che Timeo de l’anime argomenta 50 non è simile a ciò che qui si vede, 51 però che, come dice, par che senta.
query.error: **English:** 49 What Timaeus argues about souls 50 is not similar to what is seen here, 51 but, as he says, it seems that he senses it.
query.result: 49 Yattīmaḥ prāṇānām ācakṣate 50 na tattadīyam iva dṛśyate, 51 kim tu yathā sa āha jānate iva.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
52 Dice che l’alma a la sua stella riede, 53 credendo quella quindi esser decisa 54 quando natura per forma la diede;
query.error: **English:** 52 He says that the soul returns to its star, 53 believing that it was separated from it 54 when nature gave it a body;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
55 e forse sua sentenza è d’altra guisa 56 che la voce non suona, ed esser puote 57 con intenzion da non esser derisa.
query.error: **English:** 55 and perhaps his judgment is different 56 from what his words sound like, and it may be 57 with an intention that should not be mocked.
query.result: 55 Api ca tasya siddhāntaḥ anyathā asti, 56 yathoktam na śabdayati, ca bhavitum arhati 57 tādṛśena abhiprayeṇa yasya apahāsam na kartavyam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
58 S’elli intende tornare a queste ruote 59 l’onor de la influenza e ’l biasmo, forse 60 in alcun vero suo arco percuote.
query.error: **English:** 58 If he intends to return to these wheels, 59 the honor of the influence and the blame, perhaps 60 in some true bow of his he strikes.
query.result: 58 Yadi sa eṣu cakreṣu punarāvartate 59 Prabhāvasya yaśaḥapayaśca, kimcidapi 60 Asya satyadhānau kadācid abhighātam bhavati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
61 Questo principio, male inteso, torse 62 già tutto il mondo quasi, sì che Giove, 63 Mercurio e Marte a nominar trascorse.
query.error: **English:** 61 This principle, misunderstood, twisted 62 almost the whole world, so that Jupiter, 63 Mercury, and Mars it led astray in naming.
query.result: 61 Ayaṃ siddhāntaḥ, mithyā-abhijñātaḥ, avakrāśayat 62 jagat-sarvaṃ prāyaḥ, yataḥ bhagavān bṛhaspatiḥ, 63 budhaḥ, maṅgalaḥ ca nāmadheyam vyatīyayuḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
64 L’altra dubitazion che ti commove 65 ha men velen, però che sua malizia 66 non ti poria menar da me altrove.
query.error: **English:** 64 The other doubt that troubles you 65 has less venom, but its malice 66 could not lead you away from me elsewhere.
query.result: 64 Aparā saṁśayaḥ yaḥ tvām kampate 65 Sa alpam viṣaṁ dhārayati, yataḥ tasya durbuddhiḥ 66 Na śaknoti tvām anyatra mamaḥ praṇayāt vinayitum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
67 Parere ingiusta la nostra giustizia 68 ne li occhi d’i mortali, è argomento 69 di fede e non d’eretica nequizia.
query.error: **English:** 67 Our justice seems unjust 68 in the eyes of mortals, and this is proof 69 of faith and not of heretical wickedness.
query.result: 67 Naḥ nyāyo 'nyāyya iva na pratibhāti 68 martyalokasya dṛṣṭau, ayam eva 69 śraddhāyāḥ pramāṇam, na tu pāṣaṇḍadurācārasya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 Ma perché puote vostro accorgimento 71 ben penetrare a questa veritate, 72 come disiri, ti farò contento.
query.error: **English:** 70 But so that your understanding may penetrate well 71 to this truth, 72 as you desire, I will satisfy you.
query.result: 70 Api tu yathā tava prajñā 71 śaknoti sampraviśatum imam satyatām, 72 yathā icchasi, tāvad aham tvām santuṣṭam karomi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
73 Se vïolenza è quando quel che pate 74 nïente conferisce a quel che sforza, 75 non fuor quest’ alme per essa scusate:
query.error: **English:** 73 If violence is when that which suffers 74 gives nothing to that which forces it, 75 then these souls were not excused by it:
query.result: 73 Yadi hiṃsā tadā bhavati yadā yaḥ 74 na kiṃcid dadāti yaḥ praṇayati tasmai, 75 naivāsau tatraivātmānaḥ kṣamāḥ syuḥ:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
76 ché volontà, se non vuol, non s’ammorza, 77 ma fa come natura face in foco, 78 se mille volte vïolenza il torza.
query.error: **English:** 76 because the will, if it does not want, is not quenched, 77 but acts as nature does in fire, 78 even if violence twists it a thousand times.
query.result: 76 icchā hi yadi na icchati na niśamyeta, 77 kintu yathā prakṛtiḥ karoti agnau, 78 yadi sahasrakṛtvo hiṃsā vikurute.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
79 Per che, s’ella si piega assai o poco, 80 segue la forza; e così queste fero 81 possendo rifuggir nel santo loco.
query.error: **English:** 79 Therefore, if she bends much or little, 80 she follows the force; and thus these wild beasts 81 were able to flee into the holy place.
query.result: 79 Tasmāt, sā yadi atiśayam vā alpaṃ vā namati, 80 balam anveti; evam ca etāḥ kṛtyāḥ 81 śaknvantaḥ āsīt paścāt pāvanaṃ sthānam prāptum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
82 Se fosse stato lor volere intero, 83 come tenne Lorenzo in su la grada, 84 e fece Muzio a la sua man severo,
query.error: **English:** 82 If their will had been whole, 83 as Lorenzo held on the gridiron, 84 and Mucius showed himself severe to his own hand,
query.result: 82 Yadi teṣām icchā pūrṇā abhaviṣyat, 83 yathā Lorenzo agnau sthitaḥ āsīt, 84 Muziośca svayam eva hastam chinatti sma,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
85 così l’avria ripinte per la strada 86 ond’ eran tratte, come fuoro sciolte; 87 ma così salda voglia è troppo rada.
query.error: **English:** 85 thus he would have thrust them back on the road 86 from which they had been drawn, as soon as they were released; 87 but such steadfast will is too rare.
query.result: 85 tathā sa tān mārgeṇa punar niṣpādayiṣyat, 86 yataḥ tāḥ ākṛṣṭāḥ āsīt, yadā tāḥ vimuktāḥ abhavan, 87 kimtu tādṛśī dṛḍhā icchā ati durlabhā asti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
88 E per queste parole, se ricolte 89 l’hai come dei, è l’argomento casso 90 che t’avria fatto noia ancor più volte.
query.error: **English:** 88 And for these words, if you have gathered them 89 as if they were from a god, the argument is quashed 90 that would have troubled you even more times.
query.result: 88 Etac ca vacanam yadi saṃgṛhītaṃ 89 Deva iva tvayā, tad eva hetur niṣphalaḥ 90 Yaḥ punar api bahuśo duḥkham ādadāt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
91 Ma or ti s’attraversa un altro passo 92 dinanzi a li occhi, tal che per te stesso 93 non usciresti: pria saresti lasso.
query.error: **English:** 91 But now another pass blocks your eyes, 92 such that you could not get through it by yourself: 93 you would first grow weary.
query.result: 91 Api vā etarhi anyaḥ ekaḥ kramaḥ pratibaddhaḥ asti 92 tava akṣiṇoḥ agre, yena tvam svayam eva 93 na niṣkramiṣyasi: pūrva eva tvam śrāntaḥ bhaviṣyasi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
94 Io t’ho per certo ne la mente messo 95 ch’alma beata non poria mentire, 96 però ch’è sempre al primo vero appresso;
query.error: **English:** 94 I have certainly put it in your mind 95 that a blessed soul cannot lie, 96 because it is always close to the first truth;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
97 e poi potesti da Piccarda udire 98 che l’affezion del vel Costanza tenne; 99 sì ch’ella par qui meco contradire.
query.error: **English:** 97 and then you could hear from Piccarda 98 that the affection of the veil Constance held; 99 so that she seems to contradict me here.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
100 Molte fïate già, frate, addivenne 101 che, per fuggir periglio, contra grato 102 si fé di quel che far non si convenne;
query.error: **English:** 100 Many times already, brother, it happened 101 that, to escape danger, against one's will 102 one did what was not right to do;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
103 come Almeone, che, di ciò pregato 104 dal padre suo, la propria madre spense, 105 per non perder pietà si fé spietato.
query.error: **English:** 103 like Alemæon, who, urged to do so 104 by his father, killed his own mother, 105 in order not to lose piety he became impious.
query.result: 103 yathā Almenaḥ, yaḥ, tena prārthitaḥ 104 pitrā svakīyāṃ mātaraṃ jaghāna, 105 anukampāṃ na tyaktaṃ kṛtvā nirdayaḥ abhavat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
106 A questo punto voglio che tu pense 107 che la forza al voler si mischia, e fanno 108 sì che scusar non si posson l’offense.
query.error: **English:** 106 At this point I want you to consider 107 that force is mixed with the will, and they make it 108 so that offenses cannot be excused.
query.result: 106 Atra sthāne icchāmi yathā tvam cintayeḥ 107 yathā balam icchāyā saha miśram bhavati, tataśca 108 aparādhāḥ kṣamāṃ na labhante.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
109 Voglia assoluta non consente al danno; 110 ma consentevi in tanto in quanto teme, 111 se si ritrae, cadere in più affanno.
query.error: **English:** 109 Absolute desire does not consent to harm; 110 but it consents to it insofar as it fears, 111 if it draws back, to fall into greater suffering.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
112 Però, quando Piccarda quello spreme, 113 de la voglia assoluta intende, e io 114 de l’altra; sì che ver diciamo insieme».
query.error: **English:** 112 But when Piccarda speaks of that, 113 she means the absolute will, and I 114 mean the other; so that we both speak truly.
query.result: 112 Yada tu Piccardā tat spṛśati, 113 tadā sā īśvarīcicchāṃ pratipadyate, aham tu 114 anyāṃ; ata eva ubhau satyamabhidhāveva.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
115 Cotal fu l’ondeggiar del santo rio 116 ch’uscì del fonte ond’ ogne ver deriva; 117 tal puose in pace uno e altro disio.
query.error: **English:** 115 Such was the rippling of the holy river 116 that issued from the font from which every truth flows; 117 thus it quenched both the one desire and the other.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
118 «O amanza del primo amante, o diva», 119 diss’ io appresso, «il cui parlar m’inonda 120 e scalda sì, che più e più m’avviva,
query.error: **English:** 118 "O beloved of the first lover, O goddess," 119 I said then, "whose speech overwhelms me 120 and warms me so that it enlivens me more and more,
query.result: 118 "He prathamadhipapriye, he devi," 119 ahaṃ tataḥ uvāca, "yasya vāṇī mama abhyavaharati 120 evaṃ ca tāpayati yathā mama jīvanam punar api punar api vardhate,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
121 non è l’affezion mia tanto profonda, 122 che basti a render voi grazia per grazia; 123 ma quei che vede e puote a ciò risponda.
query.error: **English:** 121 my affection is not so profound 122 that it suffices to repay you grace for grace; 123 but may He who sees and can do all things respond to this."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
124 Io veggio ben che già mai non si sazia 125 nostro intelletto, se ’l ver non lo illustra 126 di fuor dal qual nessun vero si spazia.
query.error: **English:** 124 I see well that our intellect is never satisfied 125 unless the truth illuminates it 126 from outside of which no true knowledge extends.
query.result: 124 Aham suṣṭhu paśyāmi yathā na kadācid api tṛpyati 125 naḥ prajñā, yadi satyam na prakāśayati tām 126 yasya bahiḥ na kaścid eva satyaviṣayaḥ vistarati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
127 Posasi in esso, come fera in lustra, 128 tosto che giunto l’ha; e giugner puollo: 129 se non, ciascun disio sarebbe frustra.
query.error: **English:** 127 He can rest in it, like a wild beast in its lair, 128 as soon as he has reached it; and he can reach it: 129 if not, every desire would be in vain.
query.result: 127 Saḥ tatra śāmyati, mṛga iva nivasane, 128 Yada tam prāpnoti; prāptuṃ ca śaknoti: 129 Anyaथा sarve kāmāḥ niṣphalāḥ syuḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
130 Nasce per quello, a guisa di rampollo, 131 a piè del vero il dubbio; ed è natura 132 ch’al sommo pinge noi di collo in collo.
query.error: **English:** 130 Doubt is born from that, like a shoot, 131 at the foot of truth; and it is nature's way 132 that it leads us to the summit step by step.
query.result: 130 Tataḥ sambhavati, pallava iva, 131 satyasya pāde saṁśayaḥ; prakṛtiś ca 132 yad asmān śikhare niyojayati kramaśaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
133 Questo m’invita, questo m’assicura 134 con reverenza, donna, a dimandarvi 135 d’un’altra verità che m’è oscura.
query.error: **English:** 133 This invites me, this assures me 134 with reverence, lady, to ask you 135 about another truth that is obscure to me.
query.result: 133 Etad āmantryate mām, etad abhayaṃ dadāti 134 śraddhayā, devi, tava praśnotkarṣaṇāya 135 anyasya satyasya yaḥ mayāndhakāraḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
136 Io vo’ saper se l’uom può sodisfarvi 137 ai voti manchi sì con altri beni, 138 ch’a la vostra statera non sien parvi».
query.error: **English:** 136 I want to know if a man can satisfy you 137 with good vows, yes, with other goods, 138 that on your scales may not seem small.
query.result: 136 Aham jñātum icchāmi kim naraḥ śaknoti tṛptim janayitum yuṣmatsu 137 satyair vratāir eva anyaiś ca sampadbhiḥ, 138 yāḥ yuṣmatīye tulayām na bhavanti alpāḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
139 Beatrice mi guardò con li occhi pieni 140 di faville d’amor così divini, 141 che, vinta, mia virtute diè le reni,
query.error: **English:** 139 Beatrice looked at me with her eyes full 140 of such divine sparks of love, 141 that, vanquished, my virtue turned its back,
query.result: 139 Mama prati dṛṣṭim cakṣuṣā pūrṇayā 140 Premaṇā ca daivī tayā, 141 Jitā mama śaktiḥ parāṅmukhī abhavat,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
142 e quasi mi perdei con li occhi chini.
query.error: **English:** 142 and I almost lost myself with my eyes downcast.
query.result: 142 Nata-śirasā ca mama prāyaḥ vināśaḥ abhavat.
